todos.title: Consultative
todos.body: Understand their industry and bringup ideas that they might not have thought about.

todos.title: To minimize that initial churn, smart businesses focus on onboarding
todos.body: the process by which you help a customer go from (1) to (2). Making that transition as fast and smooth as possible for your customers will win you higher retention and happier customers.

todos.title: Welcome Manual
todos.body: About Us, Goals, If We Are Missing Something Let Us Know, How To, Troubleshooting

todos.title: Get them to First Success
todos.body: A disproportionate amount of your customer churn will take place between (1) and (2). That's where customers abandon your product because they get lost, don't understand something, don't get value from the product, or simply lose interest.

todos.title: Source
todos.body: 10 Great Examples of Customer Onboarding That You Can Learn From - Len Markidan

todos.title: Association and Familiarity
todos.body: When describing things, relate them to what the user is accustomed or familiar with doing in other products.

todos.title: Monitor Use & Analytics
todos.body: Watch what they are doing so you can help them correct problems before you even know they occur.

todos.title: Set Goals
todos.body: Make sure to have clearly set goals for the first onboarding session.

todos.title: Usability Testing
todos.body: If they are an early adopter, get them involved in usability testing.

todos.title: Respond Quickly
todos.body: Get back to them as soon as possible.

todos.title: Small Steps
todos.body: Don't overwhelm them in the first session.

todos.title: Avoid Fales Promises
todos.body: Be clear about expectations and deliverables.
